[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Platformi MSN defines requirements for standardizing and streamlining content delivery across digital and broadcast platforms.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Platformi automates content ingestion, processing, and secure distribution while ensuring compliance with media streaming standards.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Platformi integrates with APIs for content ingestion and third-party analytics platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Platformi provides web-based dashboards for real-time content monitoring and configuration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Platformi supports deployment on cloud-based and on-premise server infrastructures.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Platformi supports REST and SOAP-based data exchange protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Platformi ensures encrypted data exchange over HTTPS and SSL.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Platformi is optimized for efficient caching and high-speed content streaming.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Platformi ensures high availability with failover mechanisms and load balancing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Platformi is configurable for diverse digital distribution workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Platformi integrates with reporting tools for content analytics and audience insights.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Platformi manages content ingestion, transformation, and multi-platform distribution.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Platformi is designed for media professionals, content managers, and IT administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Platformi relies on stable network infrastructure and API compliance for seamless operation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Platformi requires integration with industry-standard media formats, APIs, and streaming protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Content Ingestion: Collecting data from input sources.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with third-party APIs for content ingestion.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with analytics platforms for performance insights (REQ-FUNC-004).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support multi-channel content distribution.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall ensure real-time updates for content availability (REQ-USAB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall generate analytics reports on content performance.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly dashboard for content tracking.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow configuration of distribution workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process up to 10,000 media files per day with an average processing time of under 2 seconds per file and support 500 concurrent users with a response time of less than 1 second per request (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall log all content ingestion and distribution events for audits.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall comply with ACID principles for transactional reliability.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to cloud and on-premise architecture guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with media distribution standards, including MPEG-DASH and HLS.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on traffic demands.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime for core functions.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Manuals, API documentation, and system architecture diagrams.
[SEC] 5. References: Global media standards, API protocols, and IT infrastructure guidelines.
